job_description:
Our client is an established growing part of the Higher Education technology industry. They are a Global SaaS Company with over 300 campus partners and 2 million students actively using their platform.
They help higher education institutions better engage their students, improve the student life experience on campus, and student success. They are committed to improving student success and college graduation rates worldwide by crafting digital experiences that build community and increase student engagement. They have a diverse and world-class global team poised for our next phase of rapid growth.
As the Senior Android Developer on the platform development team, you will directly impact their vision and mission of helping students succeed by bringing more institutions and students onto their robust student engagement platform through creative contributions to the mobile application development process.
 Responsibilities
Design and build advanced applications for the Android platform and suitable for use on all types of Android devices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and work on different layers of the infrastructure.
Work with outside data sources and APIs
Unit-test code including edge cases, usability, and general reliability
Work on bug fixing and improving application performance
Continuously evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
Qualifications
At least 4 years of software development experience, at least 2 years in android development with a strong understanding fo the full mobile development life cycle
Strong understanding of Android apps architecture, common design patterns, and related services.
Strong knowledge of Kotlin, readiness to learn more programming languages and platforms as needed.
Experience with Android SDK
Experience working with remote data via REST and JSON
Experience with third-party libraries and APIs
Excellent understanding of working with networks, data persistence, building performant UI.
Familiar with standard Android best practices and software design patterns such as MVP and MVVM
Proficient with GIT
Familiarity with push notifications, APIs and cloud messaging
Understanding of IT Standards, UX Design, Accessibility, Agile Methodologies
Have published at least one original Android app is a bonus
 This is a remote role based anywhere in North America.
